page.title: 04Youth Theatre (Aldridge)
page.content: This originated as a youth club whose members finally raised enough money to build a proper, if small, theatre. The local authority allowed them to use the land in Noddy Park Road, but the theatre receives no grant and has to raise all it's money except salaries paid to two youth leaders by the D.E.S.Opened by Bernard Hepton in 1977 the theatre seats 160 and provides a good community service. The stage is quite large; there are two dressing rooms, props and costume rooms, lighting box, commitee rooms, a foyer with coffee bar and car parking outside. Any one between the ages of 11 and 21 may join (though some are younger) and we pay 20p per session. Auditions are held for parts and members have to attend rehearsals. The public enjoy the Christmas pantomine most.
